items.title: Why did Bajaj Finserv's stock plunge despite an increase in Q2 profit?
items.description: Bajaj Finserv reported a 8% rise in Q2 net profit to ₹2,244 crore, but its lending arm, Bajaj Finance, saw its stock slump over 6%. This decline was triggered by a cautious outlook for future expansion and increased credit costs. Bajaj Finance also moderated its FY26 growth forecast. Meanwhile, Bajaj Allianz General Insurance posted a 5% profit increase.

items.title: Hero MotoCorp Q2 Preview: Festive demand, richer product mix could drive 16% profit growth
items.description: Hero MotoCorp is expected to post strong Q2 results, driven by festive demand, volume recovery, and a richer product mix. Brokerages project double-digit growth in revenue and profit, aided by higher ASPs, stable input costs, and improved margins. Analysts remain upbeat on Hero’s festive momentum and EV strategy.

items.title: Info Edge Q2 Results: Cons PAT soars 1,260% YoY to Rs 316 crore on one-time gain, revenue rises 15%
items.description: Info Edge reported a 7% sequential growth in PAT to Rs 296 crore for Q1FY26, with topline up 2%. The company's standalone revenue increased 14% YoY to Rs 746 crore in Q2FY26, driven by steady billing growth across its recruitment and non-recruitment businesses. Operating profit rose 6.5% YoY to Rs 268 crore.
